result.execSummary:
The defendant Gadge Raymond Hamilton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gadge Raymond Hamilton

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

1:28 PM Defendant Gadge Raymond Hamilton in court.  Attorney Mark J Gumz in court for Gadge Raymond Hamilton.  Attorney Brian J. Juech in court for State of Wisconsin. 
22CF79 & 22CF38 tracking together:
Atty Gumz states that both matters are resolved today.  
Atty Juech states plea agreement to Counts 2 & 3 in 22CF38.  Count 1 to be dismissed and read-in along with 22CF79.  Atty Gumz has something different on his plea form.  
Court will recess.

BACK ON THE RECORD:
Atty Gumz is in agreement.  Defendant agrees.  

Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea.  
Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds the defendant guilty of Counts 2 & 3 in 22CF38 and orders the judgment of conviction as of today's date. Count 1 to be dismissed and read-in along with 22CF79.

State has complied with victim notification requirements. 
Atty Juech makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Counts 3 in 22CF38:  Withhold Sentence; 12 months Probation with conditions:
*Court Costs = $243.00
*Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00
*Domestic Violence Surcharge = $100.0 on Ct. 3
*No violent or abusive contact with Victim 1
*Domestic Violence Counseling
*Comply with and complete any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent
Costs to be paid through Probation
Defendant is to contact the Probation office in Portage, WI by 4:00pm today 

Count 2:  Court orders 5 days in the Marquette County Jail; consecutive to any other sentence 
Credit = 5 days
Time Served
Court Costs = $243.00
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge = $200.00
Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing on October 1, 2022

 Count 1 to be dismissed and read-in 
22CF79 to be dismissed  and read-in
Adjourned initial appearance on September 20, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

2:45 PM Defendant Gadge Raymond Hamilton appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Mark Gumz appears by video.
22CF38 and 22CF79 tracking together:
Atty Gumz  states that the defendant doesn't qualify for the new case 22CF79 and is not part of the plea deal for the other case.  Atty Gumz asks for some time to follow-up with his client.
Atty Burdon responds and the defendant will need to be booked on the new case.

BY THE COURT:  Set next hearing in person
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Atty Burdon files the information electronically with the Court.  Atty Roberge is prepared to proceed with the Arraignment today without a hard copy of the information.  Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 

Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. 

BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. 
Set status

3:03 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gadge Raymond Hamilton appeared by video.  Attorney Rachel Roberge appeared by video for Gadge Raymond Hamilton. 
Atty Roberge states that the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.
Status hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status hearing on August 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

10:27 AM Defendant Gadge Raymond Hamilton in court.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by phone for Gadge Raymond Hamilton.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Gumz states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 
Court confirms address and phone. 
Atty Gumz waives time limits for the Prelim.  Defendant agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status hearing on June 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

03:41 PM Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Defendant Gadge Raymond Hamilton appeared by video means from Marquette County Jail.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.    Court confirms address and phone.    Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes.
  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and is going to contact the PD Office.

Atty Juech requests a $250 cash bail with conditions.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $250 Cash bond with conditions:
*No contact with Witness 1
*Defendant is allowed to go to residence one time with Law Enforcement with prior notice to the witness, to get his belongings.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
